metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Learn how to create a responsive pagination using CSS.
content.html: Learn how to create a responsive pagination using CSS.

content.text: If you have a website with lots of pages, you may wish to add some sort of pagination to each page:
content.html: If you have a website with lots of pages, you may wish to add some sort of pagination to each page:

content.code_html:
.pagination {
  display: inline-block;
}

.pagination a {
  color: black;
  float: left;
  padding: 8px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
}

content.text: Highlight the current page with an .active class, and use the :hover selector to change the color of each page link when moving the mouse over them:
content.html: Highlight the current page with an .active class, and use the :hover selector to change the color of each page link when moving the mouse over them:

content.code_html:
.pagination a.active {
  background-color: #4CAF50;
  color: white;
}

.pagination a:hover:not(.active) {background-color: #ddd;}

content.text: Add the border-radius property if you want a rounded "active" and "hover" button:
content.html: Add the border-radius property if you want a rounded "active" and "hover" button:

content.code_html:
.pagination a {
  border-radius: 5px;
}

.pagination a.active {
  border-radius: 5px;
}

content.text: Add the transition property to the page links to create a transition effect on hover:
content.html: Add the transition property to the page links to create a transition effect on hover:

content.code_html:
.pagination a {
  transition: background-color .3s;
}

content.text: Use the border property to add borders to the pagination:
content.html: Use the border property to add borders to the pagination:

content.code_html:
.pagination a {
  border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Gray */
}

content.text: Tip: Add rounded borders to your first and last link in the pagination:
content.html: Tip: Add rounded borders to your first and last link in the pagination:

content.code_html:
.pagination a:first-child {
  border-top-left-radius: 5px;
  border-bottom-left-radius: 5px;
}

.pagination a:last-child {
  border-top-right-radius: 5px;
  border-bottom-right-radius: 5px;
}

content.text: Tip: Add the margin property if you do not want to group the page links:
content.html: Tip: Add the margin property if you do not want to group the page links:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
.pagination a {  margin: 0 4px; /* 0 is for top 
and bottom. Feel free to change it */}

margin: 0 4px; /* 0 is for top 
and bottom. Feel free to change it */

/* 0 is for top 
and bottom. Feel free to change it */

and bottom. Feel free to change it */}

}

content.text: Change the size of the pagination with the font-size property:
content.html: Change the size of the pagination with the font-size property:

content.code_html:
.pagination a {
  font-size: 22px;
}

content.text: To center the pagination, wrap a container element (like <div>) around it with text-align:center
content.html: To center the pagination, wrap a container element (like <div>) around it with text-align:center

content.code_html:
.center {
  text-align: center;
}

content.text: Another variation of pagination is so-called "breadcrumbs":

content.code_html:
ul.breadcrumb {
  padding: 8px 16px;
  list-style: none;
  background-color: #eee;
}

ul.breadcrumb li {display: inline;}

ul.breadcrumb li+li:before {
  padding: 8px;
  color: black;
  content: "/\00a0";
}
